meanings.definition: Mawks (noun): A feeling of nausea or disgust.
meanings.sent1: The sight of spoiled food gave me mawks.
meanings.sent2: She wrinkled her nose in mawks at the foul smell.
meanings.sent3: The slimy texture of the food filled me with mawks.
meanings.sent4: The movie was so gross, it left a lingering mawks in my stomach.
meanings.sent5: The putrid odor in the room was a wave of mawks that made me gag.

meanings.definition: Mawks (verb): To cause someone to feel nauseous or disgusted.
meanings.sent1: The rotten eggs mawksed me as soon as I opened the fridge.
meanings.sent2: His rude behavior mawksed everyone at the party.
meanings.sent3: The prank was meant to mawks, but it ended up making us laugh.
meanings.sent4: The horror movie mawksed the audience with its gruesome scenes.
meanings.sent5: The foul smell from the garbage can mawksed the entire neighborhood.
